definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: He didn't have a care in the world as he waddled down the street.
sentences.chinese: 他摇摇摆摆走过大街的样子好像对这个世界毫无牵挂。
鸭子摇摇摆摆地走过去。

sentences.english: The soldiers swung along the street.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们沿路摇摇摆摆地前进。

sentences.english: We shadow the sea with our sails, and reelingly cleave the brine.
sentences.chinese: 将帆影撒在海面上，摇摇摆摆地分开了海水。

sentences.english: The youngsters waddled in a row behind their mother.
sentences.chinese: 在他们母亲后面的小年轻慢慢摇摇摆摆走路。

sentences.english: Finally, he is standing on shaking legs.
sentences.chinese: 终于，他摇摇摆摆地站起来了。

sentences.english: Her two-year-old son toddled into the room.
sentences.chinese: 她的两岁的儿子摇摇摆摆地走进屋里。

sentences.english: The ducks waddled across the road.
sentences.chinese: 鸭子摇摇摆摆地穿过道路。

sentences.english: The fat man waddled up to her.
sentences.chinese: 那个胖男人摇摇摆摆的向她跑去。

definition: to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
arrogant appearance/smug appearance/to act condescending/to put on airs
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
to nod one's head and wag one's tail (idiom)/to be well pleased with oneself/to have a lighthearted air
to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
